title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Workers

content.rendered:
What are Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Workers?

Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Workers work with clients to examine and treat people with both mental health and substance abuse problems.

Where do Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Workers work?

  • Hospitals
  • Social services organizations
  • Health clinics

How much do Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Workers make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Workers is $33,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Workers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Social work majors
  • Psychology majors
  • Sociology majors
Search Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Worker jobs

Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Workers skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Workers succeed in their work:

  • Ability to stay calm under pressure
  • Compassion for your patients 
  • Good counseling skills

What are some common questions about Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Workers?

Q: What should you major in if you want to be a social worker?

A: Social work, psychology, and sociology are all recommended majors.
